attributes.action: Any MP voting against their constituents Brexit vote must face recall.
attributes.background:
With Parliament having a 2/3 majority of remainers, the result of the 2016 Referendum will never be fulfilled.

MP's are voted in the represent the people who voted for them. 

If they refuse, they should face an automatic recall.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for removing MPs from office due to their views or opinions.

How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
